name: Child care and youth services
description: A field in Welfare focused on the study of the development and non-medical care of children and youths. It includes recreation and leisure activities as a social service for school children and young adults.

name: Child care
description: Providing supervision and non-medical care for children, typically in daycare centers, preschools (non-educational focus), or homes, a core component of Child care and youth services.

name: Child recreation programmes
description: Organized activities and programmes designed to provide recreation and leisure opportunities for children, part of Child care and youth services.

name: Day care
description: Supervision and care provided for children or other dependents during the day, often while parents are working, a key service within Child care and youth services.

name: Non-medical care of disabled children
description: Providing support and assistance for children with disabilities in their daily living and development, focusing on non-medical aspects, within Child care and youth services.

name: Youth services
description: Programmes and activities aimed at supporting the development, well-being, and engagement of young people, a part of Child care and youth services.

name: Youth worker programmes
description: Training for individuals who work with young people in various settings, providing guidance, support, and organizing activities, within Child care and youth services.
